Basilisk (BB).description: A basilisk is an eight-legged reptile that can turn creatures to stone just by looking at them.

Nl15bkRTLq869IPi.description:
When a creature the basilisk can see within 30 feet starts its turn, the basilisk can use its reaction to glance at the creature.

The creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save. If it fails, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} condition for 1 minute as its body slowly stiffens.
Nl15bkRTLq869IPi.name: Petrifying Glance

tOCS9mkYR5K1LuOZ.description:
The basilisk stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. If the creature can see the basilisk, that creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save.

If it fails and hasn't already gained the slowed condition from Petrifying Glance or this ability, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} condition. If the creature fails this save when it already has the slowed condition from this ability or Petrifying Glance, the creature is permanently turned to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Stone}.

A creature petrified in this manner that is coated with fresh basilisk blood is instantly restored to flesh. A single basilisk contains enough blood to coat up to 2 creatures in this manner.
tOCS9mkYR5K1LuOZ.name: Petrifying Gaze

Basilisk (BB).name: Basilisk (BB)

Brine Shark (BB).description:
Water elementals roam the endless oceans of the Plane of Water. They can be brought to the world with summoning magic or through natural disasters like floods or hurricanes. Though water elementals can be very destructive, they aren't always malicious. Just as water can bring life to those in need, its waves can pound shores and its rains flood cities. Water elementals are similarly difficult to predict.

Brine sharks take forms resembling sharks made entirely of water and are fierce, but among the weaker water elementals. They often slip into mortal oceans, competing with natural predators or even joining schools of flesh and blood sharks.

2d3ZGRIXERcjqnmJ.description: When the brine shark succeeds at its jaws Strike, it can use this action immediately after to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the target. This Grapple doesn't apply or count toward the shark's multiple attack penalty.

Fc10tuSKXi4OAWw6.description: The brine shark dives straight down into the water, swimming up to 100 feet in a straight vertical line. It can use this ability while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbing} a creature.
Fc10tuSKXi4OAWw6.name: Deep Plunge

Brine Shark (BB).name: Brine Shark (BB)

Bugbear Prowler (BB).description: These stealthy and cruel creatures delight in spreading fear and tormenting their victims. Bugbears are the monsters lurking in the closet and hiding under the bed. Preying on remote farmsteads, bugbears reveal their presence with thumps in the night or creaking boards, inspiring dread, suspicion, and fear in those they torment.

KMCE5lQxOdNEPkvf.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

e8BUlHLevzRJnHEc.description: The bugbear prowler Strides up to 10 feet and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a creature that can't see them and doesn't know where they are. If the bugbear succeeds, they also deal damage from their fist Strike to that creature.
e8BUlHLevzRJnHEc.name: Bushwhack

naotn6A029XPnJc1.description: The bugbear prowler gains a +3 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures they have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.
naotn6A029XPnJc1.name: Mauler

Bugbear Prowler (BB).name: Bugbear Prowler (BB)

Caligni Dancer (BB).description: Caligni lurk in subterranean cities, and they relish the chance to creep above ground at night to steal resources, spy on surface dwellers, or simply cause mischief.

2pO6VcGfPiv4rlTn.description: When a caligni dancer dies, their body dissolves into a swirl of darkness and light. All creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:17] save or take a -2 circumstance penalty on all attack rolls for 1 round.
2pO6VcGfPiv4rlTn.name: Final Dance

AwAca1cY9Y1Fj5kZ.description: When first exposed to bright light, the caligni can't see until the end of their next turn. All squares are difficult terrain for them, and they take a -4 status penalty to Perception. If they try to attack a creature, the attack fails unless they succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11]. Light doesn't blind them again for 1 hour.
AwAca1cY9Y1Fj5kZ.name: Light Blindness

UEVsHBxxT1scFldv.description: The caligni dancer deals an additional 1d6 damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Caligni Dancer (BB).name: Caligni Dancer (BB)

Caligni Hunter (BB).description: Caligni lurk in subterranean cities, and they relish the chance to creep above ground at night to steal resources, spy on surface dwellers, or simply cause mischief.

Q9wVJovove8AZYR8.description: The caligni hunter deals an extra 1d6 damage to creatures that have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition.
Q9wVJovove8AZYR8.name: Sneak Attack

WmxT51qlRDtAKJVg.description: The next time the hunter deals damage with a shortsword Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:16|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage and treat all creatures as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} for 1 round.
WmxT51qlRDtAKJVg.name: Darkening Poison

ehU3hdJiZTLT1KBc.description: When first exposed to bright light, the caligni can't see until the end of their next turn. All squares are difficult terrain for them, and they take a -4 status penalty to Perception. If they try to attack a creature, the attack fails unless they succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11]. Light doesn't blind them again for 1 hour.
ehU3hdJiZTLT1KBc.name: Light Blindness

ffRFGEKgA5iV2ufz.description: When a caligni hunter dies, their body explodes. All creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} must take @Damage[5d6[fire]]. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save.
ffRFGEKgA5iV2ufz.name: Final Fate

Caligni Hunter (BB).name: Caligni Hunter (BB)

Caligni Skulker (BB).description: Caligni lurk in subterranean cities, and they relish the chance to creep above ground at night to steal resources, spy on surface dwellers, or simply cause mischief.

7VcqKq1kJG1lIikf.description: When first exposed to bright light, the caligni can't see until the end of their next turn. All squares are difficult terrain for them, and they take a -4 status penalty to Perception. If they try to attack a creature, the attack fails unless they succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11]. Light doesn't blind them again for 1 hour.
7VcqKq1kJG1lIikf.name: Light Blindness

ZbD9TnQEJRZkJH2M.description: The next time the skulker deals damage with a dagger Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:16|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage and treat all creatures as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} for 1 round.
ZbD9TnQEJRZkJH2M.name: Darkening Poison

crSYz5UU8mC8VObz.description: The caligni skulker deals an extra 1d6 damage to creatures that have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition.
crSYz5UU8mC8VObz.name: Sneak Attack

tnrpIta4aIaPM8BC.description: When a caligni skulker dies, their body dissolves fog of inky darkness. All light sources within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} are extinguished. Any light spells in the area go out for 1 round.
tnrpIta4aIaPM8BC.name: Final Night

Caligni Skulker (BB).name: Caligni Skulker (BB)

Central Spears (BB).hazardDisable: A hero must succeed at a @Check[thievery|dc:18|traits:hazard|name:Disable Mechanism] check on the triggering floor tiles or the wall sockets in the western wall.
Central Spears (BB).name: Central Spears (BB)

Cinder Rat (BB).description:
Fire elementals are destructive manifestations of the Plane of Fire. They sometimes come to the world in powerful places of heat and flame where elemental vortexes form, such as in volcanoes.

Cinder rats are oversized rodents made of smoldering charcoal and elemental fire. Noxious fumes continually bellow from their flaming flesh. Much like terrestrial rats, cinder rats seek out secluded dens and can quickly multiply in number if left unchecked.

vhcrEIRKkfTwrwDs.description: A cloud of smoke surrounds the cinder rat. All creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:5]{5 feet}, including the cinder rat, gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from this smoke. A creature that comes within 5 feet of the cinder rat or begins its turn within 5 feet must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or take a -1 status penalty to all checks and DCs for 1 round (Use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}).
vhcrEIRKkfTwrwDs.name: Fetid Fumes

wqhHoIIgE3jfAgCx.description: The cinder rat ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.
wqhHoIIgE3jfAgCx.name: Smoke Vision

Cinder Rat (BB).name: Cinder Rat (BB)

Doppelganger (BB).description: Doppelgangers can transform into perfect copies of other creatures but have indeterminate forms in their natural states.

0lvwb1cNAaOUc6Be.description:
When the doppelganger is transformed with Change Shape and another creature moves adjacent to them or uses a Strike or another hostile action against them, the doppelganger can use its reaction to revert to its natural form and make a Strike against that creature.

If the creature was unaware the doppelganger was in disguise, that creature has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition against this Strike.
0lvwb1cNAaOUc6Be.name: End the Charade

LJKNy957UOv4LqE5.description: The doppelganger takes on the specific appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid it has seen. This doesn't change the doppelganger's Stride speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

fIAhNhYo8hJML5xU.description: The doppelganger attempts to read the surface thoughts of one creature within 30 feet. The target resists if it succeeds at a @Check[will|dc:21] save.
fIAhNhYo8hJML5xU.name: Mind Reading

Doppelganger (BB).name: Doppelganger (BB)

9IuPTxCvRCR7HHp2.description: When first exposed to bright light, the drow @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Can't See} until the end of their next turn. All squares are difficult terrain for them, and they take a -4 status penalty to Perception. If they try to attack a creature, the attack fails unless they succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11]. Light doesn't blind them again for 1 hour.

EdyRu3QJ0QBWzLr9.description: Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

Eejxi0k01WzbvUUh.description: If she @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm]{Raised a Shield} since her last turn, the priestess can spend her reaction to block a Strike. Reduce the Strike's damage by 5, but then she and the shield both take the remaining damage, possibly @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Breaking} or destroying the shield.

TdQYYWwQZNdBaUt2.description: A shield has 20 Hit Points. If a shield ever takes 10 damage or more, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken}. A broken shield can't be used for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm]{Raise a Shield} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block}, but you can still @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]{Repair} it. If the shield loses all 20 Hit Points, it is completely destroyed.
TdQYYWwQZNdBaUt2.name: Shield

lEQuECrdJMRfyRIL.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

Drow Sneak (BB).description: Loners at heart, drow sneaks trust no one-least of all fellow drow. These drow rely on awareness and adaptation to survive the cutthroat nature of their society.

9nfzrmPzAAStRjAe.description: The drow rogue draws a weapon using the Interact action, then Strikes with that weapon.
9nfzrmPzAAStRjAe.name: Quick Draw

NS7yHszQCqQS0Bfj.description: The drow sneak deals an extra 1d6 damage to creatures that have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition.

ufap97U4FyUOrJZF.description: When first exposed to bright light, the drow @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Can't See} until the end of their next turn. All squares are difficult terrain for them, and they take a -4 status penalty to Perception. If they try to attack a creature, the attack fails unless they succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11]. Light doesn't blind them again for 1 hour.

Drow Sneak (BB).name: Drow Sneak (BB)

Drow Warrior (BB).description: Drow are the descendants of elves corrupted by a great evil when they fled deep underground long ago.

7ogTgoQe4WAvtdJ7.description: When first exposed to bright light, the drow @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Can't See} until the end of their next turn. All squares are difficult terrain for them, and they take a -4 status penalty to Perception. If they try to attack a creature, the attack fails unless they succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11]. Light doesn't blind them again for 1 hour.

ix1KQX8Ji2g1e9ID.description: The drow warrior Strikes with their rapier, and they gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the attack roll. If they succeed, the target takes @Damage[1d6[bleed]].
ix1KQX8Ji2g1e9ID.name: Skewer

uznmLfSkP5j9qOEA.description: The drow warrior draws a weapon using the Interact action, then Strikes with that weapon.
uznmLfSkP5j9qOEA.name: Quick Draw

Drow Warrior (BB).name: Drow Warrior (BB)

Envenomed Lock (BB).description: A spring-loaded, poisoned spine is hidden near the keyhole of a lock. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disabling} or breaking the trap doesn't disable or break the lock.
Envenomed Lock (BB).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:17|traits:hazard|name:Disable the Spring Mechanism] on the spring mechanism
Envenomed Lock (BB).name: Envenomed Lock (BB)

Falling Ceiling (BB).hazardDisable: A hero must succeed at a @Check[thievery|dc:18|traits:hazard|name:Prevent Blocks from Falling] check on the triggering square or the ceiling to prevent the stone blocks from falling.
Falling Ceiling (BB).name: Falling Ceiling (BB)

Forest Troll (BB).description: Forest trolls are dim-witted, gangly giants who stalk the fringes of civilization. They rely on their incredible strength to overpower foes with their vicious claws. A troll's endless hunger drives them to consume a variety of living creatures. Trolls stand anywhere from 12 to 16 feet tall, though they prefer to hunch to lull foes into a false sense of security.

50Meu5uWTOPYtMu6.description: The troll regains 20 Hit Points at the start of their turn unless they've taken electricity or fire damage since their last turn. The troll can't die unless their regeneration is deactivated when they're reduced to 0 HP.
50Meu5uWTOPYtMu6.name: Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by Electricity or Fire)

scw9HnbCVwAyFzok.description: If the troll succeeds at two claw Strikes against the same creature in the same turn, they can use this ability to automatically deal claw Strike damage to that creature.

zWd0ku7gg194xCer.description: The forest troll gets a -4 circumstance penalty to their Perception DC against deception checks.
zWd0ku7gg194xCer.name: Easily Misled

Forest Troll (BB).name: Forest Troll (BB)

Gargoyle (BB).description:
Gargoyles are monstrous hunters made entirely of stone. They look like decorative statues and use this as camouflage to hide in plain sight in cities during the day and descend upon unlucky pedestrians at night. Their most common form is that of a horned humanoid with batlike wings, but individual gargoyles vary a great deal, with some appearing more or less humanoid and others resembling something else entirely.

Gargoyles tend to be lone hunters, though sometimes they band into groups called wings for protection or sport.

9bomxaBEHSLvRrkq.description: Until the next time they use an action, the gargoyle appears to be a statue. A creature must succeed at a @Check[perception|dc:32] check to figure out that the statue is really a creature.
9bomxaBEHSLvRrkq.name: Statue

DsvyLX53TeuZHMQ3.description: If the gargoyle is flying and a creature moves into an adjacent square below them, the gargoyle can use their reaction to make a claw Strike against that creature.
DsvyLX53TeuZHMQ3.name: Clawed Feet

Gargoyle (BB).name: Gargoyle (BB)

CfzB5r8CSHETuXfA.description: A ghost can stray no more than 120 feet from where it was killed or the place it haunts. Some are bound to items or creatures that were special to them rather than a location.
CfzB5r8CSHETuXfA.name: Site Bound

HvOzFzF3j47WTzIv.description: Setting right the injustice that led to the ghost's death allows it to move on to the afterlife. Otherwise, when destroyed, the ghost re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #Rejuvenation]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed.
HvOzFzF3j47WTzIv.name: Rejuvenation

soQbbQbVd6xMuJl6.description: A ghost has no body and can pass through physical objects, though it can't end its turn inside one. Most checks that use Strength and require a body, such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, don't work against a ghost, and a ghost can't attempt such checks.
soQbbQbVd6xMuJl6.name: Incorporeal

uYQrEbjjw3XIQ1cO.description:
Each living creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} who hears the ghost must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save. On a failure, a creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} condition (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure).

On a success, a creature can't be affected by this ghost's Frightful Moan for 1 minute.
uYQrEbjjw3XIQ1cO.name: Frightful Moan

Ghoul Stalker (BB).description: The flesh-eating undead, known as ghouls, haunt sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts, making meals of corpses. Legends say that those captured by ghouls hear foul whispers that curse them into craving raw meat, eventually turning them into ghouls.

538plQkKJgvoI49U.description: The ghoul stalker deals an extra 1d4 damage to creatures that have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition.
538plQkKJgvoI49U.name: Sneak Attack

7RTjFlVzsxhjtwX4.description:
The ghoul devours a chunk of a creature that died within the last hour and regains @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points.

The ghoul can regain Hit Points from a given body only once.
7RTjFlVzsxhjtwX4.name: Consume Flesh

iqkfB1nliXSkUpU4.description: A creature that comes within 10 feet of the ghoul and can smell the ghoul must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:14] save. On a failure, the creature takes a -1 status penalty to all checks and DCs until it uses an action to retch (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}). A creature that succeeds at its save isn't affected by any ghoul's stench for 1 minute.
iqkfB1nliXSkUpU4.name: Stench

Ghoul Stalker (BB).name: Ghoul Stalker (BB)

Giant Ant (BB).description: Giant ants form vast underground colonies, excavating deep burrows or infesting existing caverns. Giant ants look identical to their smaller kin, but their size makes them a deadly threat to farms and travelers alike.

IZMJ1l1EsTmncB5c.description: If the giant ant has a creature grabbed or restrained with its mandibles, it can spend this action to Stride up to its speed, carrying the creature with it. At the end of the Stride, place the creature in any open square adjacent to the giant ant.
IZMJ1l1EsTmncB5c.name: Haul Away

vf62uHn3Bh74svnk.description: A target that takes piercing damage from the giant ant's stinger Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage.
vf62uHn3Bh74svnk.name: Giant Ant Venom

Giant Ant (BB).name: Giant Ant (BB)

Giant Centipede (BB).description:
Centipedes are relatively common arthropods that live, hunt, and scavenge amid dung and detritus. Scurrying about with surprising speed on the scores of legs attached to their long, segmented bodies, centipedes strike with poisoned mandibles.

Most giant centipedes (known as sewer centipedes when found in cities) nest in small groups but hunt alone. Attempts to domesticate giant centipedes to use as guardians or pets generally end poorly, but some goblin and kobold societies have developed effective methods of utilizing these vermin as guardians. Some societies roast and eat centipedes, often with pungent peppers, as a savory delicacy, although care must be taken in preparing the meal to avoid contaminating the flesh with the creature's venom.

PIjZTZsbQlriq5X3.description: A target that takes piercing damage from the centipede's mandibles Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:14] save or take @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage.
PIjZTZsbQlriq5X3.name: Giant Centipede Venom

Giant Centipede (BB).name: Giant Centipede (BB)

Giant Rat (BB).description:
Giant rats are enormous versions of the common vermin. They're typically found in abundant numbers, but since they can't fit in the nooks where ordinary rats typically hide, they're much easier to locate and exterminate. In fact, finding and slaying a giant rat is a rite of passage for many an adventurer. Such tasks get tiresome quickly, so many veterans subcontract extermination to new adventurers.

Giant rats mostly live in sewers where they can scavenge from the streets above, but some families of giant rats live in more remote locations, such as dank caves, forests, or hills. Rats are incredibly adept survivors and can be found nearly anywhere in the world, though they tend to favor temperate or warm climates as opposed to cold regions.

Although their bite alone isn't lethal except to the very weak, some giant rats carry a dangerous disease common to rodents around the world-a pestilence more than capable of ravaging rural communities. The rats are merely carriers with no risk of succumbing to the disease themselves.
Giant Rat (BB).name: Giant Rat (BB)

Giant Spider (BB).description: Few everyday vermin inspire as much dread as the infamous spider. Giant spiders vary in size. The human-sized versions, sometimes called hunting spiders, are the most common type of giant spider, though not the largest.

KlwGH9hdWl3XpMYw.description: A creature hit by the giant spider's web Strike gets stuck to the nearest surface. It can't move until it successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 17).
KlwGH9hdWl3XpMYw.name: Web Trap

Odl9UZ1OKOYG044E.description: The giant spider moves straight down up to 40 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count for falling damage. A creature can Strike the web, which has AC 20 and 8 HP. If the web is reduced to 0 HP, the spider falls.
Odl9UZ1OKOYG044E.name: Descend on a Web

vnaySgTDfC0slaHW.description: A target damaged by the spider's fangs must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:16] save or take @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage and gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition for 1 round.
vnaySgTDfC0slaHW.name: Giant Spider Venom

Giant Spider (BB).name: Giant Spider (BB)

Giant Viper (BB).description:
Snakes come in an array of forms, from jungle-dwelling constrictors that wrap around their prey to venomous vipers with deadly bites. Regardless, all snakes consume their prey whole by unhinging their jaws and using powerful muscles to move the food down their throats and into their stomachs.

The giant viper's fangs, nearly as long as daggers, easily inspire fear. The venom injected by a giant viper can cause severe blood clotting and inflict tremendous damage.

1fzwu2J1jldVzBPc.description: The giant viper uses an action to coil itself. While coiled, it can target a creature up to 10 feet away with its fangs Strike. After the giant viper Strikes with its fangs, it becomes uncoiled.
1fzwu2J1jldVzBPc.name: Coil

MEjtnkYdPhtWGyzF.description: If the giant viper is coiled and a creature moves into or through a square adjacent to it, the giant viper can use its reaction to make a fangs Strike against that creature.
MEjtnkYdPhtWGyzF.name: Coiled Opportunity

lqMgsu5wZAOsEwK2.description: A target damaged by the snake's fangs must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save or take @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage.
lqMgsu5wZAOsEwK2.name: Giant Viper Venom

Giant Viper (BB).name: Giant Viper (BB)

Goblin Commando (BB).description:
Most goblin communities teeter in a state of barely controlled disarray-a collective of creatures operating largely on gut instinct rarely follows any clear direction. Even goblin leaders tend to be impulsive, irresponsible, and generally just not that good at actually leading.

In theory, goblin commandos lead goblin raids. In practice, goblin commandos rarely continue to lead their comrades once a battle has begun. Most shirk their responsibilities in favor of wading into the fray and claiming glory from their kin.

YdD2kpKW2TNfcupL.description: If a goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to the goblin commando, the commando can use their reaction to Step.
YdD2kpKW2TNfcupL.name: Goblin Scuttle

Goblin Commando (BB).name: Goblin Commando (BB)

Goblin Igniter (BB).description:
Goblins find fire totally fascinating. It makes light. It's great for cooking. It's a fun toy! Some goblins take their people's admiration of fire a little bit too far and into the realm of deadly obsession.

Goblins who turn their attentions to magic so they can learn to make fire from nothing are known as goblin igniters. These flame fanatics can be a great boon to a band of goblin raiders eager to torch their enemies and wreak havoc. More often, however, their presence is a double-edged sword. In the heat of the moment, goblin igniters sometimes lose sight of their goals and simply set fire to anything that will burn-including their own allies!

otqsXx9gjh7rnOpU.description: If a goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to the goblin igniter, the igniter can use their reaction to Step.
otqsXx9gjh7rnOpU.name: Goblin Scuttle

Goblin Igniter (BB).name: Goblin Igniter (BB)

Goblin Warrior (BB).description:
The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups-especially when they can outnumber their foes by at least three to one. One doesn't need intense training or great toughness to become a goblin warrior. Anyone can aspire to this role, or be drafted into it during an emergency.

Goblin warriors delight in wreaking havoc. They think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing infants, or burning down buildings purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks." What the goblins lack in consistency, long-term planning, and good sense, they make up for in sheer bravery and commitment.

czwGWW73rkPW7vBg.description: If a goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to the goblin warrior, the warrior can use their reaction to Step.
czwGWW73rkPW7vBg.name: Goblin Scuttle

Goblin Warrior (BB).name: Goblin Warrior (BB)

Harpy (BB).description: Harpies are an amalgamation of human and bird, using their ancestral control of the wind to lure prey or even directly pull in their next meal. Harpies can eat most creatures, but prefer to eat humans and elves in particular. Harpies live in family groups or larger clans, although they rarely hunt in big groups, preferring to keep most meals for themselves.

IqOAXLLKjSYmNd2w.description: The harpy uses the wind to pull its prey closer. A target within 20 feet must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save or be pulled adjacent to the harpy. The harpy then makes a jaws strike against the target. If the target is pulled into the air and cannot fly, it falls as normal.
IqOAXLLKjSYmNd2w.name: Hungry Winds

X36hKYEWL0S6irBU.description: A creature that comes within 30 feet of the harpy and can smell the harpy must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save. On a failure, the creature takes a -1 status penalty to all checks and DCs until it uses an action to retch. A creature that succeeds at its save isn't affected by any harpy's stenches for 1 minute.
X36hKYEWL0S6irBU.name: Stench

Harpy (BB).name: Harpy (BB)

Hell Hound (BB).description: Temperamental and quick to aggressive behavior, hell hounds are fiendish canines from a hellish plane. They're skilled hunters and can breathe supernatural gouts of flame from their maws. A hell hound's appearance leaves no doubts as to its infernal origins-flesh the color of burning pitch, teeth as sharp as any fiend's pitchfork, and a shroud of ever-burning hellfire are all trademark features. Though they can't speak, they understand Diabolic, the language of Hell.

GsQeeSV97T6FPvoY.description:
The hell hound breathes flames that deal @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:15]. Each affected creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save.

The hell hound can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hellfire Breath]]{1d4 rounds}. If the hell hound would take fire damage or is the target of a fire effect, its Hellfire Breath recharges.
GsQeeSV97T6FPvoY.name: Hellfire Breath

gHFLr2q5cyBdthRD.description: The hell hound's jaws Strike deals 1d4 extra damage to creatures within reach of two of the hell hounds' allies.
gHFLr2q5cyBdthRD.name: Pack Attack

Hell Hound (BB).name: Hell Hound (BB)

Hidden Pit (BB).description: A wooden trapdoor covers a 10-foot square pit that's 20 feet deep.
Hidden Pit (BB).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:12|traits:hazard|name:Remove the Trapdoor] to remove the trapdoor.
Hidden Pit (BB).name: Hidden Pit (BB)

Hobgoblin Soldier (BB).description: Hobgoblins are singularly devoted to war, and their entire civilization is built upon fostering and maintaining conflict while simultaneously proving their superiority in battle. Highly organized, they work efficiently and effectively in groups, whether that group is a small raiding party, a roving war band, or a fully regimented army. Physically, hobgoblins stand about as tall as humans and have gray, ashen skin.

HKe6thyQBV2VB7mx.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

OgkLVLhW0uOMdbGj.description: When they're adjacent to at least two other allies, the hobgoblin soldier gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws.
OgkLVLhW0uOMdbGj.name: Formation

pwxZNOfMOm5horoq.description: A shield has 20 Hit Points. If a shield ever takes 10 damage or more, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken}. A broken shield can't be used for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm]{Raise a Shield} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block}, but you can still @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]{Repair} it. If the shield loses all 20 Hit Points, it is completely destroyed.
pwxZNOfMOm5horoq.name: Shield

xolLzAgsgpzS6Nvn.description: If they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm]{Raised a Shield} since their last turn, the hobgoblin can spend their reaction to block a Strike. Reduce the damage by 5, but the hobgoblin and the shield both take the remaining damage, possibly @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Breaking} or destroying the shield.

Hobgoblin Soldier (BB).name: Hobgoblin Soldier (BB)

94P2S8OyxiovGujz.description: When a creature within 10 feet uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using, the dragon can use their reaction to make a tail Strike at the creature with a -2 penalty. If it hits, the creature stops moving in the square it was in when the dragon used this reaction.
94P2S8OyxiovGujz.name: Twisting Tail

d5UuF56WuHzskPO4.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.
d5UuF56WuHzskPO4.name: Draconic Frenzy

j90G6J5zvaIVNb1q.description:
The dragon breathes a toxic cloud that deals @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save.

The dragon can't use their Poison Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Poison Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
j90G6J5zvaIVNb1q.name: Poison Breath

kkKlT3cO51Wj2tz5.description: When the dragon gets a critical success on a Strike, they recharge their Poison Breath.
kkKlT3cO51Wj2tz5.name: Draconic Momentum

SKxww784aC4E2gzW.description: Zolgran deals an extra 1d6 damage to creatures that have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition.

Kobold Dragon Mage (Black, BB).description: Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who are often seen in the service of more powerful creatures. They lurk in dark places, usually tunnels and mines. Kobold mages use magic to carry out their schemes, often in service of a dragon or other powerful creatures.

SMaOHeglwFS3CxB8.description: If the kobold is adjacent to at least one enemy, the kobold Strides up to 30 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. The kobold must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.
SMaOHeglwFS3CxB8.name: Scamper

Kobold Dragon Mage (Black, BB).name: Kobold Dragon Mage (Black, BB)

Kobold Dragon Mage (Blue, BB).description: Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who are often seen in the service of more powerful creatures. They lurk in dark places, usually tunnels and mines. Kobold mages use magic to carry out their schemes, often in service of a dragon or other powerful creatures.

Cw6X0IHLwQFUP0s6.description: If the kobold is adjacent to at least one enemy, the kobold Strides up to 30 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. The kobold must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.
Cw6X0IHLwQFUP0s6.name: Scamper

Kobold Dragon Mage (Blue, BB).name: Kobold Dragon Mage (Blue, BB)

Kobold Dragon Mage (Green, BB).description: Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who are often seen in the service of more powerful creatures. They lurk in dark places, usually tunnels and mines. Kobold mages use magic to carry out their schemes, often in service of a dragon or other powerful creatures.

Y5pZ1lg8o21ONX8u.description: If the kobold is adjacent to at least one enemy, the kobold Strides up to 30 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. The kobold must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.
Y5pZ1lg8o21ONX8u.name: Scamper

Kobold Dragon Mage (Green, BB).name: Kobold Dragon Mage (Green, BB)

Kobold Dragon Mage (Red, BB).description: Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who are often seen in the service of more powerful creatures. They lurk in dark places, usually tunnels and mines. Kobold mages use magic to carry out their schemes, often in service of a dragon or other powerful creatures.

KQueYD9OGjRs0G5n.description: If the kobold is adjacent to at least one enemy, the kobold Strides up to 30 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. The kobold must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.
KQueYD9OGjRs0G5n.name: Scamper

Kobold Dragon Mage (Red, BB).name: Kobold Dragon Mage (Red, BB)

Kobold Dragon Mage (White, BB).description: Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who are often seen in the service of more powerful creatures. They lurk in dark places, usually tunnels and mines. Kobold mages use magic to carry out their schemes, often in service of a dragon or other powerful creatures.

rjagZN22fOCrVrUz.description: If the kobold is adjacent to at least one enemy, the kobold Strides up to 30 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. The kobold must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.
rjagZN22fOCrVrUz.name: Scamper

Kobold Dragon Mage (White, BB).name: Kobold Dragon Mage (White, BB)

Kobold Scout (BB).description: Most kobolds encountered outside of a well-defended warren or lair are kobold scouts, trained for stalking and the hunt. They're charged with bringing food and valuable goods back to the community. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without putting themselves at much risk.

BRVL1ixeyP9uFjWm.description: If the kobold is adjacent to at least one enemy, the kobold Strides up to 30 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. The kobold must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.
BRVL1ixeyP9uFjWm.name: Scamper

MO9W8NpBALoHHtTS.description: The kobold scout deals an extra 1d6 damage to creatures that have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition.

Kobold Scout (BB).name: Kobold Scout (BB)

Kobold Trapmaster (BB).description: Kobold trapmasters are the masterminds behind crafting and implementing wily traps in kobold lairs, and are widely respected among their kind.

CHJtUAFotmtE0vu1.description: If the kobold is adjacent to at least one enemy, the kobold Strides up to 30 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. The kobold must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.
CHJtUAFotmtE0vu1.name: Scamper

Mcbgf9KdTTBPuio6.description:
The kobold trapmaster deploys one of their spike traps in an adjacent square.

Once this trap is deployed in a square, it deals @Damage[2d8[piercing]|name:Spike Trap] damage to anyone who steps on that square and they must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] saving throw. A hero takes no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, full damage on a failure, and double damage on a critical failure. These traps can be disabled with a successful @Check[thievery|dc:15|traits:action:disable-a-device] check.
Mcbgf9KdTTBPuio6.name: Quick Trap

fx6MEhp40JvDajQh.description: This basic snare consists of hidden spikes that rely on a creature's momentum to lacerate or potentially impale it as it enters the snare's square, dealing 2d8 piercing damage. The creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] saving throw.
fx6MEhp40JvDajQh.name: Spike Trap

yDzPXpPBRfYG5UfY.description: The kobold trapmaster deals an extra 1d6 damage to creatures that have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition.

Kobold Trapmaster (BB).name: Kobold Trapmaster (BB)

Kobold Warrior (BB).description:
A typical kobold trains with simple weaponry. Kobolds are capable of landing sneaky strikes against unsuspecting foes, but they're just as quick to scamper off to safety if their group wouldn't outnumber their enemies by at least two to one.

Kobolds believe in pragmatism, and a defeated kobold would rather surrender than face death. One might even abandon their kobold kin and concede to serve the victor if the alternative is an untimely demise.

8tPur0BcpKXkeGRe.description: If the kobold is adjacent to at least one enemy, the kobold Strides up to 30 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. The kobold must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.
8tPur0BcpKXkeGRe.name: Scamper

D0BJOT03V2FE7mKT.description: The kobold warrior deals an extra 1d4 damage to creatures that have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition.

Kobold Warrior (BB).name: Kobold Warrior (BB)

Leopard (BB).description: Leopards range from the iconic yellow with black spots to black panthers and white-furred, black-spotted snow leopards. Few predators can match their talent for stalking and stealth.

5o4Qh26axxAvJeUp.description: When the leopard succeeds at its jaws Strike, it can use this action immediately after to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the target. This Grapple doesn't apply or count toward the leopard's multiple attack penalty.

8Hc25NUrYBwSHQuO.description: The leopard deals an extra 1d4 damage to creatures that have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition.

iuFRjKw2PLJl3E3F.description: The leopard Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the leopard successfully used @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} before this action, the target has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition against this Strike.
iuFRjKw2PLJl3E3F.name: Pounce

uEjliLhQWBsVYCsE.description: The leopard makes two claw Strikes against a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}. The second attack uses the same multiple attack penalty as the first, but later attacks that turn take a -10 multiple attack penalty (or -8 for its claws).
uEjliLhQWBsVYCsE.name: Maul

Leopard (BB).name: Leopard (BB)

Mermaid Fountain (BB).hazardDisable:
@Check[thievery|dc:20|traits:complex,hazard|name:Disable Mechanism] on each corner mechanism (must disable all three working corners to disable the trap)

Each corner mechanism has hardness 8 and 15 HP
Mermaid Fountain (BB).hazardRoutine:
Each turn, the fountain uses 1 action. Roll a [[/r 1d10]]{1d10} and look up the result on the following list to determine which action it uses that round.

  • 1-4 Single Target The statue spins about and sprays water at a single random target in the room. Roll a [[/r 1d4]]{1d4} and count to the number you rolled, starting with the player on your left, to determine which hero gets attacked. The spray is a ranged Strike.
  • 5-7 Corner Spray The statue spins about, firing a spray of water at each corner of the room that still has a functioning corner mechanism. This hits any creature adjacent to the corner mechanism, dealing @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage. Each hero must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:15|basic|traits:hazard], taking no damage on a critical success, half damage on a success, full damage on a failure, and double damage on a critical failure.
  • 8-9 Half Room The statue spins about, spraying half of the room with water. Roll any die. If the result is even, it sprays the west half; otherwise, it sprays the east half. This deals @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage to each creature in that half of the room, and each hero must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:15|basic|traits:hazard] save.
  • 10 Full Room This works just like the half-room attack, but it targets everyone in the room.
Mermaid Fountain (BB).name: Mermaid Fountain (BB)

Mimic (BB).description:
Thought to be the result of a failed experiment meant to animate objects or a sinister alghollthu creation, mimics are clever monsters that can take the form of common manufactured objects. Mimics are ambush predators and voracious eaters, surprising their prey through their uncanny ability to mimic the form of common furniture and miscellany. They remain disguised until unsuspecting adventurers happen by, then they lash out in ambush.

Mimics possess complex alien minds, and while often cruel and self-serving, they also enjoy conversation with their prey from time to time. For unknown reasons, they are especially interested in humanoids. Mimics have a strong dislike for others of their kind and tend to live alone. A mimic can remain in its alternate form for an extremely long period of time, sometimes remaining disguised in a dungeon chamber for decades. Regardless of how long it waits, the mimic remains vigilant and alert, ready to strike at any moment.

91iOrkVbzeP7cK2M.description: Any creature that touches the mimic (usually from a fist Strike, the mimic's pseudopod, or a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}) must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:23] save or gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} condition. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} is 23. A melee or thrown weapon that hits the mimic sticks to it. A character can spend an action to attempt a @Check[athletics|dc:23] check, removing the weapon on a success. The adhesive dissolves 1 minute after the mimic dies.
91iOrkVbzeP7cK2M.name: Adhesive

M3QwWIU2rzRHWndo.description: The mimic assumes the shape of any Medium object. This alters its visual appearance but not its size. It takes a @Check[perception|dc:28] check to tell the object is a creature.
M3QwWIU2rzRHWndo.name: Mimic Object

Ns2pok7e6UtuKUd6.description: If a creature touches the mimic while the mimic is transformed into an object, the mimic can spend its reaction to use its adhesive with no saving throw. The mimic then makes a pseudopod Strike. Object Lesson can't be used again until the mimic escapes and takes on a new disguise.
Ns2pok7e6UtuKUd6.name: Object Lesson

Mimic (BB).name: Mimic (BB)

Minotaur Hunter (BB).description: A minotaur is a large humanoid with a bovine head and hooves. Though often mistaken for aggressive brutes, many minotaurs are skilled artisans. Lone minotaurs tend to make their lairs within a maze or old ruin, hunting anyone who dares to invade their labyrinthine home.

3STgLL5iZEI8pSTn.description: The minotaur makes two Strikes with its greataxe against two adjacent enemies, both of whom are within its reach. The second attack uses the same multiple attack penalty as the first, but attacks it makes after this take a -10 multiple attack penalty.
3STgLL5iZEI8pSTn.name: Axe Swipe

bQRnxgh1VHMUoffw.description: The minotaur Strides twice, then makes a horn Strike. If the moved at least 20 feet from their starting position, the Strike's damage is increased to 2d8+10 piercing.
bQRnxgh1VHMUoffw.name: Powerful Charge

fOwVEwaZPmB4enaL.description: A minotaur automatically critically succeeds on Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.fJImDBQfqfjKJOhk]{Sense Direction} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track}.
fOwVEwaZPmB4enaL.name: Perfect Orienteering

Minotaur Hunter (BB).name: Minotaur Hunter (BB)

Ogre Warrior (BB).description:
Ogres embody cruelty and brutish, amoral violence. Standing 10 feet tall and densely muscled, ogres are as strong as they are cruel. They typically enjoy remorseless violence in all of its forms. Although they prefer to vent their violent urges on smaller humanoids-the smaller, the better-ogres promise a horrifying fate for anyone unlucky enough to fall within their meaty grasp.

Always eager for mayhem and murder, ogre warriors are quick to turn on their kin when there's a shortage of smaller folk to torment, so those who lead ogres do their best to keep them constantly distracted with new opportunities for raids and ruin. An ogre's deficits in both patience and intelligence make them easy to trick, giving cunning captives many ways to get the better of them.

GHc2nhxovHIDiS0W.description: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded", having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.

Ogre Warrior (BB).name: Ogre Warrior (BB)

Orc Commander (BB).description: When orcs raid, the strongest is chosen as the leader. Bonds of blood are especially strong among orcs, and the mightiest orc holds are typically made up of siblings who have chosen a strong commander to protect their kinfolk.

xDUpwWQaZevQOkYQ.description: When the orc is reduced to 0 Hit Points, they can use their reaction to remain conscious with 1 Hit Point, but they gain the wounded 1 condition (or increases the wounded value by 1 if they already have that condition). The orc can't use this ability at wounded 3.

yeHohyJSYfiTwghO.description:
Bellowing mightily, the commander gives themself and all orc allies within @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} who can hear them a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls until the start of the orc commander's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Yqq4AkZ9lrm4CcID]{Effect: Battle Cry}
yeHohyJSYfiTwghO.name: Battle Cry

Orc Commander (BB).name: Orc Commander (BB)

Orc Scrapper (BB).description: Orcs are proud, strong humanoids that live by the rule that might makes right. They amass in warbands both large and small, conquering territory and robbing those unlucky enough to cross their path. Countless small settlements, outposts, and forts have fallen at the hands of orc raiders, whose sheer destructiveness leaves an indelible mark on the lands they conquer. The furious and undisciplined rankand-file scrappers make up the bulk of an orc warband.

CellesdPVQW5Dk8g.description: When the orc is reduced to 0 Hit Points, they can use their reaction to remain conscious with 1 Hit Point, but they gain the wounded 1 condition (or increases the wounded value by 1 if they already have that condition). The orc can't use this ability at wounded 3.

Orc Scrapper (BB).name: Orc Scrapper (BB)

Orc Veteran (BB).description: The typical orc trooper is a violent combatant familiar to many adventurers. Orc warriors fight for their holds, for riches, and-perhaps most of all-for glory. Proving their own strength improves their station within their orc hold, so battle is a crucial part of life for any orc who aspires to one day lead or go down in history.

4D2PeMPJfrwdbJ3e.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half-plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

AtTvfif8mNvTl8HD.description: When the orc is reduced to 0 Hit Points, they can use their reaction to remain conscious with 1 Hit Point, but they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded 1} condition (or increases the wounded value by 1 if they already have that condition). The orc can't use this ability at wounded 3.

Orc Veteran (BB).name: Orc Veteran (BB)

Owlbear (BB).description: The owlbear is a territorial predator with the body of a brown bear but the head-and resultant keen senses-of an owl.

TyHmjC5wvxo29J5L.description: When the owlbear succeeds at its talon Strike, it can use this action immediately after to automatically give the target the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} condition until the end of its next turn.

qCmKPruRObzVL1Dr.description: The owlbear makes a Bloodcurdling Screech and Strides twice. All creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:80]{80 feet} of the owlbear at any point during this movement are subjected to the effects of Bloodcurdling Screech.
qCmKPruRObzVL1Dr.name: Screeching Advance

vTXaShzYmcNbRjzk.description: Each creature within @Template[emanation|distance:80]{80 feet} who can hear the owlbear's screech must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] save. The creatures can't be affected by another screech for 1 minute. On a critical success, the creature is unaffected; on a success, the creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} condition; on a failure, the creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} condition; on a critical failure, the creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} condition and must spend its next turn running away from the owlbear.
vTXaShzYmcNbRjzk.name: Bloodcurdling Screech

Owlbear (BB).name: Owlbear (BB)

Pugwampi (BB).description: Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who enjoy causing inventive destructiveness. Dog-faced pugwampis are craven, and they take great joy in the accidents and missteps caused by the ill fortune they magically project.

AGjtcz0cAWzBXlEx.description:
Creatures other than animals, gremlins, and kholo within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} become extremely unlucky. They must attempt a @Check[will|dc:16] save, rolling this Will save twice and using the worse result.

On a successful save, the creature can't be affected by pugwampi unluck auras for 24 hours. On a failure, the creature must roll twice and use the worse result on all checks as long as it's within 20 feet of the pugwampi.

Multiple pugwampis don't create any increased effect.
AGjtcz0cAWzBXlEx.name: Unluck Aura

EJQ6j0rq9FWVsYiO.name: -2 Penalty on Perception to Hear things

IgVFPfZjnGqYSVAI.description: Pugwampis can talk to and understand animals.
IgVFPfZjnGqYSVAI.name: Animal Talker

Pugwampi (BB).name: Pugwampi (BB)

Reefclaw (BB).description: Reefclaws are aquatic monsters that resemble huge shrimp or lobsters. Though reefclaws can't speak, they are intelligent enough to understand the local language of humanoids near their hunting grounds.

QC6Qfhm9C414P0oL.description: If the reefclaw has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, it can spend one action to crush them in its coils. The creature takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage depending on its @Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic] save.
QC6Qfhm9C414P0oL.name: Constrict

RkZmlmhuBgERLtp0.description: When the reefclaw is reduced to 0 hit points it can spend this reaction to make a claw Strike before dying.
RkZmlmhuBgERLtp0.name: Death Frenzy

kExVKNRglkSawA2u.description: A target that takes slashing damage from the reefclaw's claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage.
kExVKNRglkSawA2u.name: Reefclaw Venom

mge8vQkbMqv0OxCE.description: When the reeflclaw succeeds at its claw Strike, it can use this action immediately after to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the target. This Grapple doesn't apply or count toward the reefclaw's multiple attack penalty.
mge8vQkbMqv0OxCE.name: Grab

Reefclaw (BB).name: Reefclaw (BB)

Scythe Blades (BB).description: Two blades, each hidden in a 15-foot-long ceiling groove, are both connected to a trip wire.
Scythe Blades (BB).name: Scythe Blades (BB)

Sewer Ooze (BB).description: These amorphous masses of sewage and detritus make their way through filthy culverts beneath cities. Some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

VwrlDdZczBGO5Ps4.description: A sewer ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement, allowing it to fight as well as if it could see. However, a sewer ooze can't see, so effects that depend on vision or seeing don't work on it.
VwrlDdZczBGO5Ps4.name: Motion Sense 60 feet

mdqK7RuSjtezVyS8.description:
The sewer ooze unleashes a wave of filth, covering all creatures within 20 feet of itself. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:17|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d4[acid]] damage and a -10-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute (on a critical failure, the creature also falls over and gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} condition). A creature can Interact to clean someone off. This decreases the Speed penalty to -5 feet after 1 action, or to no penalty after 2 actions. After using Filth Wave, the ooze can't use it again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Qomp2EujVCbzJb4X]{Effect: Filth Wave}
mdqK7RuSjtezVyS8.name: Filth Wave

Sewer Ooze (BB).name: Sewer Ooze (BB)

Shadow (BB).description: Undead shadows feed on those who stray from the light.

0QWVJ7Of8cQNKp0N.description: The shadow can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.
0QWVJ7Of8cQNKp0N.name: Slink in Shadows

0Qt9ULbGzJV8ZG3W.description: When a creature's shadow is pulled free by Steal Shadow, it becomes a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.clzHAfegb9Rn6DOe]{Shadow Spawn} under the command of the shadow that created it. This shadow spawn doesn't have Steal Shadow and is perpetually and incurably @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}. If the creature the shadow spawn was pulled from dies, the shadow spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous shadow. If the creature recovers from its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeeblement}, its shadow returns to it and the shadow spawn is extinguished.
0Qt9ULbGzJV8ZG3W.name: Shadow Spawn

ACHlnYzXVxizzqPw.description: Attacks against the shadow are treated as magical if the shadow or the weapon being used is in light.
ACHlnYzXVxizzqPw.name: Light Vulnerability

Kjifw1jgDvfmrEGU.description: If the shadow hit a living creature with a Strike on its previous action, it can use this action to pull at the target's shadow, imposing a -1 status penalty to Athletics and to attack rolls and damage rolls that use Strength. The penalty increases each time a shadow uses this ability to a maximum of -4. The penalty decreases by 1 every hour.
Kjifw1jgDvfmrEGU.name: Steal Shadow

tS9Kv6K4kwYFjHCT.description: A shadow has no body and can pass through physical objects, though it can't end its turn inside one. Most checks that use Strength and require a body, such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, don't work against a shadow, and a shadow can't use them.
tS9Kv6K4kwYFjHCT.name: Incorporeal

Shadow (BB).name: Shadow (BB)

Skeletal Giant (BB).description: The reanimated bones of giants make excellent necromantic thralls, and the skeletal giants made out of bull-headed minotaurs are no exception. Mindless skeletons use similar tactics, so using a bigger, more durable skeleton is the only way a necromancer can obtain a more powerful thrall.

4gkC6A8D27Jzv7nH.description: The skeletal giant makes two Strikes with its greataxe against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within its reach. The second attack uses the same multiple attack penalty as the first, but attacks it makes after this take a -10 multiple attack penalty (or a -8 multiple attack penalty for its horns).
4gkC6A8D27Jzv7nH.name: Broad Swipe

J4YIWviUaTHDEl3b.description: Half plate consists of most of the upper body plates used in full plate, with lighter or sparser steel plate protection for the arms and legs. This provides some of the protection of full plate with greater flexibility and speed. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of padded armor and a pair of gauntlets.

emPcqeSFXdyr6CgV.description:
The giant Strides and makes a horns Strike with a +4 circumstance bonus to damage.

If the strike hits, the giant attempts to [[/act demoralize]] the target.
emPcqeSFXdyr6CgV.name: Terrifying Charge

Skeletal Giant (BB).name: Skeletal Giant (BB)

Skeleton Guard (BB).description:
Made from bones held together by foul necromancy, skeletons can often be found haunting old dungeons and patrolling forgotten cemeteries. Many evil masterminds prefer to keep eternally vigilant undead as minions to avoid the upkeep required to feed and satisfy the psychological needs of living guardians.

Simple skeleton guards remain the most common skeletal minions. These skeletons are mindless, meaning they can't truly reason but can execute their basic guard duties of watching out for and attacking intruders. A group of several skeletons defending the same location usually consists of melee fighters and archers who shoot arrows from afar.
Skeleton Guard (BB).name: Skeleton Guard (BB)

Slamming Door (BB).description: Pressure-sensitive panels in the floor connect to a stone slab hidden in a hallway's ceiling.
Slamming Door (BB).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:15|traits:hazard|name:Disable Floor Panels] on the floor panels before the slab falls.
Slamming Door (BB).name: Slamming Door (BB)

Sod Hound (BB).description:
Earth elementals such as sod hounds make excellent bodyguards for spelunkers and are ideal protectors of important subterranean locations. Coming from the Plane of Earth, they often appear in caverns deep underground.

Sod hounds take the form of mossy canines made of packed dirt and pebbles. They can band together with other sod hounds, traveling as a pack.

3USivzG0qztGd1dK.description: When the sod hound succeeds at its jaws Strike, it can use this action immediately after to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the target. This Trip doesn't apply or count toward the sod hound's multiple attack penalty.

59wy5xK7MEQmYRxg.description: The sod hound burrows through any earthen matter, including rock. It moves up to 20 feet, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.
59wy5xK7MEQmYRxg.name: Earth Glide

hDYxH5VuENin7Q0I.description: A sod hound can sense crystals or gems within 60 feet.
hDYxH5VuENin7Q0I.name: Crystal Sense 60 feet

Sod Hound (BB).name: Sod Hound (BB)

Spear Launcher (BB).description: A wall socket loaded with a spear connects to a floor tile in one 5-foot square.
Spear Launcher (BB).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:18|traits:hazard|name:Disable Mechanism] on the floor tile or wall socket.
Spear Launcher (BB).name: Spear Launcher (BB)

Viper (BB).description:
Each member of this family of venomous snakes has long, hinged fangs that inject potent venom into their prey. Different vipers inject different types of venom, which might result in paralysis, extreme pain and swelling, blood clotting, or even the sudden stopping of the victim's heart.

Though far less of an imposing physical threat than a giant viper, a common viper poses far more danger than its size would suggest. A viper mainly hunts small mammals or lizards but will attack a humanoid it perceives as a threat.

TnaXi3v3iBDjotwd.description: A target damaged by the viper's fangs must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:16] save or take @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage.
TnaXi3v3iBDjotwd.name: Viper Venom

YIHoSZN2nTp139Dg.description: If a creature ends its movement adjacent to the viper or within the viper's space, the viper can use its reaction to Stride, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swim} up to 10 feet. It must end its movement in a location that isn't within 5 feet of a foe. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.
YIHoSZN2nTp139Dg.name: Slink

Viper (BB).name: Viper (BB)

Warg (BB).description: Wargs are often mistaken for wolves, but they have a cunning intelligence and the ability to speak. Wargs often form hunting parties with orcs and hobgoblins. Most wargs are amenable to this arrangement, but if food should run out, wargs are more than willing to integrate goblinoid flesh into their diet.

0gOGUlxb9h78zefM.description: When the warg succeeds at its jaws Strike, it can use this action immediately after to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the target. This Grapple doesn't apply or count toward the warg's multiple attack penalty.

Db24UdpGiWsgWITM.description: If the warg has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, it can spend one action to shred them with its teeth. The creature takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage and can make a @Check[fortitude|dc:18|basic] save.
Db24UdpGiWsgWITM.name: Shred

KapyaNm62BvUi1J6.description: The warg's jaws Strike deals 1d4 extra damage to creatures within reach of two of the warg's allies.
KapyaNm62BvUi1J6.name: Pack Attack

VLWCAVOCAqcO4PEB.description: When a creature within the reach of the warg's bite attacks one of its allies, the warg can spend its reaction to make a jaws Strike against that creature.
VLWCAVOCAqcO4PEB.name: Avenging Bite

Warg (BB).name: Warg (BB)

Web Lurker (BB).description: Web lurkers, known also as ettercaps, are ugly monsters that not only dwell within the lairs of spiders and swarms, but actively cultivate and shepherd such vermin. Web lurkers hunt in forests, swamps, or scrubby hill lands. They construct structures from their webs high up in trees or within craggy, high canyons, and they surround their territory with traps constructed of the same webbing and natural material.

Kj1uqisygxPxuaC9.description: The web lurker can speak with and understand spiders.
Kj1uqisygxPxuaC9.name: Spider Speak

P7JMDrm2HB1QPV3N.description: A target damaged by the web lurker's fangs must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save or take @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage and gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition for 1 round.
P7JMDrm2HB1QPV3N.name: Web Lurker Venom

Re5HgCWQJTyzGewL.description: A creature hit by the web lurker's web attack gets stuck to the nearest surface. It can't move until it successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 20).
Re5HgCWQJTyzGewL.name: Web Trap

Web Lurker (BB).name: Web Lurker (BB)

Wight (BB).description: Wights are undead humanoids that lurk in burial grounds, catacombs, or other places of the dead.

Kpl3lLjfHM0hWhT5.description: When the wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it can use its reaction to make a Strike before being destroyed. It doesn't gain any Hit Points from corrupting spite on this Strike.
Kpl3lLjfHM0hWhT5.name: Final Spite

v2Ifd6tb1IDRFqFO.description:
When the wight deals damage to a living creature with its claw or dagger Strike, the wight regains @Damage[2[void,healing]|shortLabel] Hit Points and the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save or take 2 damage that can't be healed. The wight can use corrupting spite multiple times, but a single creature can't take more than 8 unhealable damage.

Each full night of rest heals 2 of the unhealable damage, and a full day of bed rest increases the recovery to 4 of the unhealable damage.
v2Ifd6tb1IDRFqFO.name: Corrupting Spite

Wight (BB).name: Wight (BB)

Wolf (BB).description: Wolves roam forests, hills, and other wild lands, where they live and hunt in packs. Contrary to popular belief, these packs aren't led by the strongest in the group, but typically consist of a mated pair, their pups, and juvenile offspring from previous mating seasons. Offspring generally leave their parents' pack upon reaching maturity, at which point they seek out mates of their own to form their own packs elsewhere. Wolves don't typically view humanoids as prey animals, but extraordinary circumstances can lead wolves to attack people, especially in winter months and other situations where traditional prey (such as deer and elk) are scarce.

GhRRqxvK6T21zheo.description: The wolf's jaws Strike deals 1d4 extra damage to creatures within reach of two of the wolf's allies.
GhRRqxvK6T21zheo.name: Pack Attack

dB4Pr3yiNKH32fE8.description: When the wolf succeeds at its jaws Strike, it can use this action immediately after to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the target. This Trip doesn't apply or count toward the wolf's multiple attack penalty.

Wolf (BB).name: Wolf (BB)

Xulgath Leader (BB).description: Xulgath leaders exhibit greater strength and more affinity for violence than other members of a xulgath community.

RX6HAClLi39MgLLI.description: The xulgath boss makes two Strikes with their greataxe against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within their reach, with a +1 circumstance bonus. The second attack uses the same multiple attack penalty as the first, but attacks the xulgath boss makes after this take a -10 multiple attack penalty (or a -8 multiple attack penalty for its claw).
RX6HAClLi39MgLLI.name: Swipe

Vebk6mvEAQ2umwd9.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half-plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

gV8plzH46OeVvlNG.description: A creature that comes within @Template[emanation|distance:30] of the xulgath and can smell the xulgath must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save. On a failure, the creature takes a -1 status penalty to all checks and DCs until it uses an action to retch. A creature that succeeds at its save isn't affected by any xulgaths' stenches for 1 minute (Use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}).
gV8plzH46OeVvlNG.name: Stench

yW3k0nAo6sWO1GvX.description: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded", having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.

Xulgath Leader (BB).name: Xulgath Leader (BB)

Xulgath Warrior (BB).description: Reptilian humanoids living underground, xulgaths (known as troglodytes to many surface dwellers) attack intruders in their territory on sight. They live in familial communities, battling rival groups and other aggressive underground inhabitants to survive. They occasionally raid surface settlements, usually at the behest of cruel, bloodthirsty leaders. A typical xulgath has dull gray, dark gray, or ashen scales with a long tail and bony protrusions down the length of their spine.

4NqTHQqAkLmiUovi.description: A creature that comes within @Template[emanation|distance:30] of the xulgath and can smell the xulgath must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:16] save. On a failure, the creature takes a -1 status penalty to all checks and DCs until it uses an action to retch. A creature that succeeds at its save isn't affected by any xulgaths' stenches for 1 minute (Use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}).
4NqTHQqAkLmiUovi.name: Stench

Xulgath Warrior (BB).name: Xulgath Warrior (BB)

Zephyr Hawk (BB).description:
Air elementals, such as a zephyr hawk, appear in a variety of sizes and shapes. From the Plane of Air, zephyr hawks are often summoned to be used as airborne messengers. Air elementals can also arrive spontaneously during powerful storms and tornadoes where elemental vortexes form.

Zephyr hawks appear to be made of clouds, with distinct shapes that give them the appearance of having the wings and beaks of birds. When one sees clouds that resemble animals, they're often unknowingly observing air elementals. Zephyr hawks sometimes drift among wind currents in great flocks called casts.

x8uwJOVGskq8pjOH.description: The zephyr hawk flies up to half its Speed, makes two wing Strikes, then flies up to half its Speed again to return to its original location. The second half of this movement doesn't trigger reactions like Reactive Strike. The second attack uses the same multiple attack penalty as the first, but attacks it makes after this take a -8 multiple attack penalty.
x8uwJOVGskq8pjOH.name: Circling Attack

Zephyr Hawk (BB).name: Zephyr Hawk (BB)

Zombie Shambler (BB).description: A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed. Among the living dead, zombies are most often used as fodder, wearing down defenses before more powerful undead arrive to deal the killing blow. Zombies can't truly think for themselves, but they can be commanded by other allied undead and powerful necromancers.

Qknp3UNQSMjNTUmL.description: When the zombie succeeds at its fist Strike, it can use this action immediately after to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the target. This Grapple doesn't apply or count toward the zombie's multiple attack penalty.

eulyI60JHNUYs39w.description: A zombie has only 2 actions on its turn, and it can't use reactions.
eulyI60JHNUYs39w.name: Slow

v90WRjELLiKF57vr.description: Requirements The zombie has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.
v90WRjELLiKF57vr.name: Jaws

Zombie Shambler (BB).name: Zombie Shambler (BB)
